item.title: [DERBY-3465] 'testNetworkServerSecurityMechanism' fails with 'junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: did not expect an sqlexception'.
item.description:
http://dbtg.thresher.com/derby/test/trunk15/jvm1.5/testing/testlog/SunOS-5.10_i86pc-i386/630954-org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.suites.All_diff.txt

at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:25)

item.environment:
OS: Solaris 10 6/06 s10x_u2wos_09a X86 64bits - SunOS 5.10 Generic_118855-14
JVM: Sun Microsystems Inc., java version "1.5.0_14", Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_14-b03), Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_14-b03, mixed mode)
item.summary: 'testNetworkServerSecurityMechanism' fails with 'junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: did not expect an sqlexception'.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Component/s, Affects Version/s, and Environment did not show... Trying to edit...

I built this rev (630954) and ran it with Java 1.5.0_14 on Solaris 10/x86 with sane jars, but was unable to reproduce it.
A comment in the code preceding the fail says:

// Exceptions expected in certain cases depending on JCE used for
// running the test, but in this case, we don't expect any
// sqlexceptions

which is an indication this could be related to the JCE (Java Security Extension) in use. Does the test run
with a a custom JCE? Pity the fail() call masks the exception...

I also tried to reproduce this, without success.
Solaris 10 (x86), Sun JDK 1.4.2, 1.5 and 1.6. I ran the test individually.

'derby-3465-1a-remove_try_catch.diff' removes what I think is unnecessary try-catch clauses.
If the error happens again, we might hopefully get a more helpful error message.

Test runs without errors on my system with the patch applied.
A review is very much appreciated.

I tried the patch and it ran cleanly on Solaris 10/x86 with Java 1.5 and 1.6.
Changes look good, no need for the test to catch these exceptions.

+1

Thank you for the review Dag.

The test also ran cleanly for me, and I committed 'derby-3465-1a-remove_try_catch.diff' to trunk with revision 631286.
If the test fails again, we might hopefully get some more helpful information and can investigate the problem.

I guess we just have to wait for a while before we resolve the issue.
I removed all the locale jars from the classpath and split it up, as it broke the formatting pretty bad.
